page.title: 11DAYS GONE BY
page.content: The clothes they had were school clothes and Sunday best clothes. The old people of the village think that you got better value for money than you do today. Food and rent have gone up most of all the things in the 1950's. Some people kept the family on ten shillings (50p), a week. The most commonly read newspaper was the Daily Herald. {MOORENDS 1985} Moorends is a small mining village in South Yorkshire. The area on which it is situated is flat and mainly used for farming. It was once a vast area of marsh land. The population is approximately 6000. There are two areas to Moorends, one which was built 15-20yrs ago and the old part of the village which consists of mining houses. These were N.C.B. property but now are Council owned.
